tasks.details:

1. Start with layouts/app.blade.php as the foundation
2. Use PHP-CS-Fixer or manual formatting to restore proper indentation
3. Remove all duplicate class attributes using regex: class="[^"]*"\s+class="
4. Fix broken HTML structure - ensure all tags are properly nested

6. Restore proper Blade directives (@section, @yield, @component)
7. Implement proper component separation
8. Fix navigation.blade.php and footer.blade.php components

tasks.title: Eliminate All Inline Styles
tasks.description: Remove all 414+ inline styles and convert to Tailwind utility classes
tasks.details:
Inline style elimination process:
1. Create mapping of common inline styles to Tailwind equivalents
2. Process files in order of importance: home.blade.php, conversions/*.blade.php, components/*.blade.php
3. Convert style="background: ..." to bg-* classes
4. Convert style="color: ..." to text-* classes
5. Convert style="padding/margin: ..." to p-*/m-* classes
6. Handle complex styles with custom Tailwind utilities
7. Update tailwind.config.js for any missing utilities
8. Use @apply directive in app.css only when necessary
9. Ensure zero inline styles remain using grep verification
10. Document any edge cases that require special handling

tasks.title: Audit: Scan entire codebase for remaining inline styles and CSS violations
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive automated and manual audit to identify and document all remaining inline styles, CSS violations, and style-related anti-patterns across the entire codebase including dynamically generated content and third-party components
tasks.details:
Comprehensive inline styles and CSS violations audit process:

1. AUTOMATED INLINE STYLES DETECTION:
   - Execute recursive grep search: grep -r 'style="' resources/ app/ public/ --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor
   - Scan Blade templates: find resources/views -name '*.blade.php' -exec grep -H 'style="' {} \;
   - Check PHP files for dynamic style generation: grep -r '->style(' app/
   - Scan JavaScript for DOM style manipulation: grep -r '.style.' resources/js/
   - Search for setAttribute('style'): grep -r 'setAttribute.*style' resources/js/
   - Identify Alpine.js :style bindings: grep -r ':style=' resources/views/

2. CSS ANTI-PATTERN DETECTION:
   - Search for !important overrides: grep -r '!important' resources/css/
   - Identify overly specific selectors (> 3 levels): Use CSS analyzer tools
   - Find duplicate CSS rules across files
   - Detect unused CSS classes using PurgeCSS dry-run
   - Identify hardcoded colors/dimensions instead of CSS variables
   - Find inline <style> tags in templates: grep -r '<style' resources/views/

3. THIRD-PARTY COMPONENT AUDIT:
   - Scan vendor directory for bundled CSS: find vendor/ -name '*.css' -o -name '*.min.css'
   - Check node_modules for imported styles with inline overrides
   - Audit Laravel components for style attributes
   - Review any WYSIWYG editor outputs for inline styles
   - Check email templates for necessary inline styles (these may be required)

4. DYNAMIC CONTENT ANALYSIS:
   - Review TransformationService.php for any HTML generation with styles
   - Check AJAX responses for HTML fragments with inline styles
   - Audit any user-generated content sanitization for style attributes
   - Scan database seeders/migrations for HTML content with styles

5. BUILD PROCESS VERIFICATION:
   - Verify Vite/Mix isn't injecting inline styles
   - Check if any PostCSS plugins are adding inline styles
   - Ensure no build-time style injections in compiled assets
   - Review manifest.json for style handling

6. DOCUMENTATION GENERATION:
   - Create detailed report: inline_styles_audit_report.md
   - Categorize findings by severity:
     * CRITICAL: Inline styles breaking responsive design
     * HIGH: Inline styles overriding theme system
     * MEDIUM: Unnecessary inline styles that should be classes
     * LOW: Acceptable inline styles (emails, dynamic calculations)
   - Generate fix priority list with file locations and line numbers
   - Create migration plan for converting inline styles to utility classes

7. AUTOMATED REMEDIATION SCRIPT:
   - Develop PHP artisan command: php artisan audit:inline-styles
   - Create automatic conversion suggestions for common patterns
   - Generate Tailwind utility class equivalents for inline styles
   - Output JSON report for CI/CD integration

tasks.details:

2. XSS VULNERABILITY AUDIT:
   - Scan all Blade templates for unescaped output: grep -r '{!!' resources/views/ --include='*.blade.php'
   - Check for dangerous HTML attribute bindings without sanitization
   - Audit JavaScript for innerHTML usage: grep -r 'innerHTML' resources/js/
   - Verify Content Security Policy headers are properly configured
   - Check for user input reflection in meta tags and JSON-LD

3. CSRF PROTECTION VERIFICATION:
   - Verify VerifyCsrfToken middleware is active in app/Http/Kernel.php
   - Audit all forms for @csrf directive: grep -r '<form' resources/views/ | grep -v '@csrf'
   - Check AJAX requests include CSRF token in headers
   - Review app/Http/Middleware/VerifyCsrfToken.php for unnecessary exceptions
   - Validate META csrf-token tag exists in layout files

4. SQL INJECTION PREVENTION:
   - Scan for raw SQL queries: grep -r 'DB::raw\|DB::select\|DB::statement' app/
   - Audit Eloquent whereRaw usage for parameterization
   - Check for string concatenation in queries
   - Review all user input handling in database operations
   - Verify prepared statements are used consistently

5. AUTHENTICATION & AUTHORIZATION:
   - Review authentication middleware implementation
   - Check for hardcoded credentials: grep -r 'password.*=.*["'][^"']*["']' app/ config/
   - Audit session configuration in config/session.php
   - Verify secure and httponly flags on cookies
   - Check for proper password hashing (bcrypt/argon2)
   - Review rate limiting on authentication endpoints

6. SENSITIVE DATA EXPOSURE:
   - Scan for exposed API keys: grep -r 'api_key\|apikey\|secret' --exclude-dir=vendor
   - Check .env.example doesn't contain real credentials
   - Verify .env is in .gitignore
   - Audit debug mode settings for production
   - Check for sensitive data in error messages
   - Review logging for PII exposure

7. FILE UPLOAD SECURITY:
   - Verify file type validation exists
   - Check for path traversal vulnerabilities
   - Audit file size limits
   - Ensure uploaded files stored outside web root
   - Verify MIME type checking implementation

8. HEADER SECURITY:
   - Check for security headers: X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Strict-Transport-Security
   - Verify CORS configuration is restrictive
   - Audit Content-Security-Policy implementation
   - Check for information disclosure headers

9. DEPENDENCY VULNERABILITIES:
   - Review composer.lock for known vulnerabilities
   - Check package-lock.json for security advisories
   - Audit third-party CDN usage
   - Verify all dependencies are from trusted sources

10. CONFIGURATION SECURITY:
    - Review config/*.php for production-safe settings

    - Check database.php for secure connection settings

   - Scan all Eloquent model relationships for missing eager loading
   - Audit all transformation tool database calls in TransformationService.php

3. INDEX ANALYSIS:
   - Generate index usage report: SHOW INDEX FROM all_tables
   - Run EXPLAIN on all queries to identify missing indexes
   - Analyze slow query log for queries without index usage

tasks.details:
Comprehensive automated test script implementation for all transformation tools: 1. TEST FRAMEWORK SETUP: - Create test-all-transformations.php script in project root - Import TransformationService class from app/Services/TransformationService.php - Set up structured logging with timestamps and detailed results - Configure memory limit to 256MB for large input testing: ini_set('memory_limit', '256M') - Create results directory: mkdir -p test-results/transformations - Initialize CSV report file with headers: tool_name, input_type, test_case, result, execution_time, memory_usage, error_message 2. TEST INPUT PREPARATION: - Create standard test inputs array with multiple scenarios: * Empty string: '' * Single character: 'a' * Normal text: 'Hello World 123!' * Unicode text: 'Héllö Wörld 你好世界 🌍' * Numbers only: '1234567890' * Special characters: '!@#$%^&*()_+-=[]{}|;:,.<>?' * Long text (1000 chars): str_repeat('Lorem ipsum ', 100) * Very long text (10000 chars): str_repeat('Test content ', 1000) * Mixed case: 'ThIs Is MiXeD cAsE TeXt' * HTML content: '
Test HTML content
' * JSON string: '{"key": "value", "number": 123}' * SQL-like string: 'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = 1' * Code snippet: 'function test() { return true; }' * Multi-line text: "Line 1\nLine 2\nLine 3" * Whitespace variations: ' spaces tabs\t\tnewlines\n\n' 3. TOOL ITERATION AND TESTING: - Load all 172 tools from TransformationService::getAvailableTransformations() - For each tool, iterate through all test inputs - Wrap each transformation in try-catch block - Measure execution time using microtime(true) - Track memory usage with memory_get_usage() - Log each test result with tool name, input type, output, and metrics 4. SPECIFIC TOOL CATEGORY TESTS: - Case transformations (uppercase, lowercase, title case, etc.): * Verify idempotent operations (applying twice yields same result) * Check Unicode handling for accented characters - Encoding/Decoding tools (Base64, URL encode, etc.): * Verify encode->decode returns original * Test binary data handling - Hash functions (MD5, SHA256, etc.): * Verify consistent output for same input * Check empty string handling - Text manipulation (reverse, remove spaces, etc.): * Test preservation of Unicode characters * Verify whitespace handling - Counting tools (word count, character count, etc.): * Verify numeric output format * Test accuracy with known inputs 5. ERROR SCENARIO TESTING: - Test with null input (if applicable) - Test with extremely long strings (100KB+) - Test with binary data for text-only tools - Test with malformed data for parsers (JSON, XML, etc.) - Test with recursive/nested structures - Monitor for PHP warnings and notices 6. OUTPUT VALIDATION: - Verify output is not null unless expected - Check output encoding (UTF-8 compliance) - Validate output length constraints - Ensure no data corruption or truncation - Compare with expected results for known transformations 7. PERFORMANCE METRICS: - Record execution time for each transformation - Track memory usage before and after - Identify tools taking >1 second - Flag tools using >10MB memory - Calculate average performance per tool category 8. RESULT COMPILATION: - Generate summary statistics: * Total tests run * Pass/fail counts per tool * Average execution times * Memory usage patterns * Most common error types - Create detailed JSON report with all results - Generate HTML dashboard with visual charts - Export CSV for further analysis - Log critical failures separately 9. CONTINUOUS INTEGRATION: - Create PHPUnit test wrapper for CI/CD - Set up GitHub Actions workflow - Configure failure thresholds - Enable automated regression testing 10. DOCUMENTATION: - Generate tool compatibility matrix - Document known limitations per tool - Create input/output examples - Build troubleshooting guide

tasks.details:
CRITICAL STYLING FAILURE RESOLUTION:

1. IMMEDIATE DIAGNOSTICS:
   - Check browser console for CSS 404 errors or failed stylesheet loads
   - Verify public/css/app.css exists and has content: ls -la public/css/
   - Check if mix-manifest.json or vite-manifest.json exists and is valid
   - Inspect page source for <link> tags pointing to correct CSS files
   - Verify CSS is not being blocked by Content Security Policy headers
   - Check network tab for failed CSS requests or MIME type errors

2. BUILD PIPELINE VERIFICATION:
   - Check package.json for correct build scripts: npm run build or npm run dev
   - Verify postcss.config.js exists with correct Tailwind plugin configuration
   - Check tailwind.config.js content paths: './resources/**/*.blade.php', './resources/**/*.js'
   - Test CSS compilation: npm run build && check public/css/app.css size
   - Verify webpack.mix.js or vite.config.js for proper CSS processing
   - Check for node_modules integrity: rm -rf node_modules && npm install

3. TAILWIND CONFIGURATION AUDIT:
   - Verify @tailwind directives in resources/css/app.css: @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities;
   - Check tailwind.config.js for proper content paths and theme configuration
   - Verify PostCSS plugins order: tailwindcss, autoprefixer in postcss.config.js
   - Test Tailwind JIT mode if enabled: mode: 'jit' in config
   - Check for conflicting CSS frameworks or reset stylesheets
   - Verify PurgeCSS not removing needed styles in production

4. STYLESHEET LOADING FIXES:
   - Check resources/views/layouts/app.blade.php for proper CSS inclusion
   - Verify @vite(['resources/css/app.css']) or mix('/css/app.css') in Blade templates
   - Ensure <link> tags in correct order: reset, vendor, app, custom
   - Check for missing rel="stylesheet" or type="text/css" attributes
   - Verify no duplicate or conflicting stylesheet loads
   - Test with absolute paths if relative paths failing

5. CSS FILE INTEGRITY:
   - Check if app.css is empty or corrupted: cat public/css/app.css | head -100
   - Verify CSS syntax errors: npx postcss resources/css/app.css --check
   - Look for malformed @import statements breaking compilation
   - Check for Unicode/encoding issues in CSS files
   - Verify no circular dependencies in CSS imports
   - Test with minimal CSS to isolate compilation issues

6. ASSET COMPILATION REPAIR:
   - Clear all caches: php artisan cache:clear && php artisan view:clear
   - Delete compiled assets: rm -rf public/css/* public/js/* public/mix-manifest.json
   - Rebuild from scratch: npm run build
   - Check Laravel Mix or Vite output for compilation errors
   - Verify file permissions on public/css directory: chmod -R 755 public/css
   - Test with npm run watch for real-time compilation feedback

7. BROWSER AND CDN ISSUES:
   - Clear browser cache and hard refresh: Ctrl+Shift+R
   - Check if CDN/CloudFlare caching old or broken CSS
   - Verify no browser extensions blocking stylesheets
   - Test in incognito/private mode to rule out cache issues
   - Check for CORS errors if CSS hosted on different domain
   - Verify HTTPS/HTTP protocol matches for all assets

8. EMERGENCY FALLBACK:
   - Add Tailwind CDN temporarily: <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>
   - Include critical inline styles in <head> for immediate fix
   - Create minimal working CSS file to restore basic functionality
   - Document all broken style references for systematic repair

tasks.title: Create Robust Laravel Blade Layouts with TALL Stack, CSP, and Accessibility
tasks.description: Develop the core application layouts (e.g., app.blade.php, guest.blade.php) using Laravel Blade components, ensuring strict CSP compliance, full TALL stack integration, and adherence to WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.
tasks.details:
Implementation of foundational Blade layouts for Case Changer Pro:

1.  **Layout Scaffolding:**
    *   Create a main authenticated layout `resources/views/layouts/app.blade.php`.
    *   Create a guest layout `resources/views/layouts/guest.blade.php` for login, registration, etc.
    *   Utilize Blade anonymous components and slots for modularity (e.g., `<x-app-layout> {{ $slot }} </x-app-layout>`).
    *   Structure layouts with semantic HTML5 tags: `<header>`, `<footer>`, `<nav>`, and a `<main>` tag wrapping the main content slot.

2.  **TALL Stack & Asset Integration:**
    *   Integrate Vite for asset bundling using the `@vite()` directive in the `<head>`.
    *   Include Livewire assets using `@livewireStyles` in the `<head>` and `@livewireScripts` before the closing `</body>` tag.
    *   Ensure the layout correctly loads the CSS from the design system (Task 4) and the JS from the chosen framework (Task 24).

3.  **Content Security Policy (CSP) Compliance:**
    *   Eliminate ALL inline `style` attributes. All styling must be implemented via Tailwind CSS utility classes from the established design system.
    *   Remove ALL inline `<script>` tags. All JavaScript functionality must be handled by the CSP-compliant framework chosen in Task 24 and bundled via Vite.
    *   Implement a Laravel middleware to generate and attach a unique `nonce` to each request. Apply this nonce to all script and style tags loaded via the `@vite` directive to comply with a `script-src 'nonce-...'` policy (e.g., `@vite([...], nonce: csp_nonce())`).

4.  **Accessibility (a11y) Implementation:**
    *   Set the `lang` attribute on the `<html>` tag dynamically (e.g., `lang="{{ str_replace('_', '-', app()->getLocale()) }}"`).
    *   Implement a visually hidden "Skip to main content" link as the first focusable element in the `<body>` for keyboard users.
    *   Ensure the document has a logical heading structure and that all interactive elements have clear focus states defined in the global CSS.
    *   Use ARIA attributes where necessary, for example, for navigation menus or dynamic content regions, to enhance screen reader compatibility.

2.  **Accessibility Audit:**

subtasks.title: Implement and Apply CSP Nonce Middleware
subtasks.description: Develop a Laravel middleware to generate a unique nonce on each request and attach it to script and style tags. This is a critical step for achieving a strict Content Security Policy (CSP) by disallowing inline execution.
subtasks.details:
1. Create a new middleware (e.g., `AddContentSecurityPolicyHeaders`).
2. In the middleware, generate a secure, unique nonce and configure it to be accessible in Blade views (e.g., via a helper function `csp_nonce()`).
3. The middleware must add a `Content-Security-Policy` header to the response, forbidding `'unsafe-inline'` and `'unsafe-eval'`, and allowing scripts/styles via `'nonce-...'`.
4. Update the `@vite()` directive in the layouts to pass the nonce: `@vite([...], nonce: csp_nonce())`.
5. Perform a full audit to ensure no inline `style` attributes or `<script>` tags remain in the layouts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Enable the middleware globally or on a test route. Use browser developer tools to inspect the response headers for the `Content-Security-Policy` header. Verify that the `<script>` and `<link>` tags generated by Vite have the matching `nonce` attribute. Confirm there are no CSP violation errors in the browser console.

subtasks.title: Integrate Core Accessibility (a11y) Features

subtasks.details:
1. Implement a 'Skip to main content' link as the first focusable element in the `<body>`. The link should be visually hidden by default but become visible on focus.
2. Add `id="main-content"` to the `<main>` tag to serve as the anchor for the skip link.
3. Add an `aria-label` to the primary `<nav>` element (e.g., `aria-label="Main Navigation"`).
4. Ensure all interactive elements planned for the header/footer (e.g., navigation links, buttons) have clear focus states defined in the global CSS (from Task 4).

Activating the link should move focus to the `<main>` element. Use an automated tool like Axe DevTools to scan the rendered layout for basic accessibility issues.

subtasks.title: Refactor Layouts into Reusable Blade Components
subtasks.description: Convert the `app.blade.php` and `guest.blade.php` files into anonymous Blade components to promote modularity and align with modern Laravel best practices. This makes the layouts easily reusable with a simple tag-based syntax.

   - Fix component registration syntax: Alpine.data('componentName', () => ({...}))
   - Register navigation components: dropdown, mobileMenu, themeToggle, searchModal
   - Register converter component with proper state management
   - Add error handling for missing component definitions

3. EVENT LISTENER TIMING:
   - Wrap Alpine.start() in DOMContentLoaded event listener
   - Implement document.readyState check for late script execution
   - Add fallback for Alpine already initialized scenarios
   - Ensure Livewire compatibility if present: window.livewire?.start()

4. CSP COMPLIANCE UPDATES:
   - Remove any inline event handlers that violate CSP
   - Convert onclick/onchange to Alpine @click/@change directives
   - Ensure no eval() or Function() constructors in initialization
   - Add nonce support for dynamic script execution if needed

5. MODULE STRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS:
   - Organize imports at top of file: import Alpine from 'alpinejs'
   - Import all component modules in correct order
   - Set up proper export/import chain from component files
   - Add Alpine plugins if needed: persist, focus, collapse

6. INITIALIZATION CODE PATTERN:
   ```javascript
   // Import Alpine and plugins
   import Alpine from 'alpinejs'
   import persist from '@alpinejs/persist'
   import converter from './alpine-converter'
   import navigation from './alpine-navigation'
   
   // Register plugins
   Alpine.plugin(persist)
   
   // Register all components before start
   Alpine.data('converter', converter)
   Alpine.data('navigation', navigation)
   Alpine.data('dropdown', () => ({ open: false }))
   Alpine.data('themeToggle', () => ({...}))
   
   // Global Alpine for debugging
   window.Alpine = Alpine
   
   // Start Alpine when DOM ready
   if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
     document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => Alpine.start())
   } else {
     Alpine.start()
   }
   ```

   - Add try-catch blocks around component registration
   - Implement console logging for initialization stages in dev mode
   - Add Alpine.version check for compatibility
   - Create initialization status indicator: window.__alpineInitialized

Ensure these methods have access to the component's state (e.g., `this.inputText`, `this.copied`). 3. **Refactor Blade Template**: In `home.blade.php`, replace the complex `x-data` attribute with a simple component instantiation, e.g., `
`. tasks.title: Implement Dynamic Transformation Tool Selector UI
tasks.description: Create a user-friendly transformation tool selector UI for the homepage and category pages, featuring quick-access buttons for popular tools and a comprehensive, searchable dropdown for all other transformations.
tasks.details:
1. **UI/UX Research and Design:**
   - Research best practices for tool selection, focusing on progressive disclosure patterns. Analyze competitor implementations to inform the design.
   - Design a component with a primary row of 4-5 buttons for the most popular/context-relevant transformations.
   - Include a 'More Tools' or 'All Tools' dropdown button that reveals a searchable, categorized list of all 210+ transformations.
   - Ensure the design is fully integrated with the existing Glassmorphism Design System (Task 4) and light/dark themes (Task 40).

2. **Blade Component Creation (`transformation-selector.blade.php`):**
   - Create a new reusable Blade component in `resources/views/components/`.
   - The component will accept props: `popularTools` (array), `allTools` (categorized collection), and `currentTool` (string, optional).
   - The component should be self-contained and manage its own state using Alpine.js.

3. **Frontend Interactivity (Alpine.js):**
   - Implement state management for the dropdown's visibility and search query.
   - Create a computed property in Alpine.js to filter the `allTools` list based on the user's search input.
   - On tool selection (from either a button or the dropdown), the component will dispatch a custom browser event, e.g., `new CustomEvent('tool-selected', { detail: { toolId: 'slug-of-tool' } })`. This decouples the selector from the main transformation logic.

4. **Integration with Pages:**
   - Modify `resources/views/home.blade.php` (from Task 31) to include `<x-transformation-selector />` near the main text input area. The controller must pass the globally popular tools.
   - Modify `resources/views/conversions/category.blade.php` (from Task 32) to include the same component. The controller must pass contextually relevant popular tools for that specific category.
   - The main page's JavaScript will listen for the `tool-selected` event to update its state and prepare the correct transformation function from the registry created in Task 34.

5. **Accessibility and Styling:**
   - Ensure the component is fully keyboard accessible: Tab to navigate between buttons and the dropdown trigger, Arrow keys to navigate the dropdown list, Enter/Space to select, and Esc to close the dropdown.
   - Implement proper ARIA attributes: `aria-haspopup="true"`, `aria-expanded`, `role="menu"`, `role="menuitem"` for the dropdown.

tasks.title: Register and Configure CSP Middleware
tasks.description: Register ContentSecurityPolicy middleware in Kernel.php, configure CSP helper function, verify nonce injection into script/style tags, and test CSP header generation to ensure no unsafe-eval directive.
tasks.details:
Complete CSP middleware implementation and configuration:

1. MIDDLEWARE REGISTRATION:
   - Open app/Http/Kernel.php and add ContentSecurityPolicy middleware to global middleware stack
   - Position middleware after TrustProxies but before other security headers
   - Register as: \App\Http\Middleware\ContentSecurityPolicy::class
   - Ensure middleware loads on every request, not just web routes

2. CSP MIDDLEWARE IMPLEMENTATION:
   - Create/update app/Http/Middleware/ContentSecurityPolicy.php if not exists
   - Generate unique nonce per request using Str::random(32)
   - Store nonce in request attributes for blade/view access
   - Build CSP header with directives:
     • default-src 'self'
     • script-src 'self' 'nonce-{$nonce}' https://cdn.jsdelivr.net
     • style-src 'self' 'nonce-{$nonce}' https://fonts.googleapis.com
     • font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com
     • img-src 'self' data: https:
     • connect-src 'self'
   - Explicitly exclude 'unsafe-eval' and 'unsafe-inline' from all directives

3. CSP HELPER FUNCTION SETUP:
   - Create app/Helpers/csp.php with csp_nonce() function
   - Function should retrieve nonce from request()->attributes->get('csp-nonce')
   - Register helper file in composer.json autoload files array
   - Run composer dump-autoload to load helper globally

4. BLADE DIRECTIVE CONFIGURATION:
   - Register @cspnonce Blade directive in AppServiceProvider boot method
   - Directive should output: nonce="{{ csp_nonce() }}"
   - Make directive available in all Blade templates

5. NONCE INJECTION VERIFICATION:
   - Update app.blade.php layout to include nonce in all <script> tags
   - Add nonce attribute to Alpine.js CDN script tag
   - Add nonce to app.js script tag
   - Add nonce to any inline <style> tags
   - Verify transformation-selector component scripts have nonce

6. PRODUCTION FILE INTEGRATION:
   - Ensure CSP-fixed versions from Task 45 work with new middleware
   - Verify no conflicts between middleware nonces and component logic
   - Test that Alpine components initialize without CSP violations

7. CONFIGURATION OPTIONS:
   - Add CSP_ENABLED env variable (default: true)
   - Add CSP_REPORT_URI for violation reporting endpoint
   - Allow environment-specific CSP policies (stricter for production)
   - Document all configuration options in .env.example
tasks.testStrategy:
Comprehensive CSP middleware validation:

1. MIDDLEWARE REGISTRATION TEST:
   - Run php artisan middleware:list
   - Verify ContentSecurityPolicy appears in global middleware list
   - Confirm middleware executes on every request via logging

2. CSP HEADER VERIFICATION:
   - Use curl -I http://localhost to check response headers
   - Verify Content-Security-Policy header is present
   - Confirm header contains nonce-based directives
   - Ensure NO 'unsafe-eval' or 'unsafe-inline' in any directive

     * LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) < 2.5s
     * FID (First Input Delay) < 100ms

2. **WCAG 2.1 AA COMPLIANCE TESTING:**
   - Install axe-core for automated accessibility testing: npm install --save-dev @axe-core/cli

     * Proper heading hierarchy (h1-h6)

tasks.description: Replace the core Alpine.js universal converter component with a new Livewire component to achieve strict CSP compliance, and redesign the transformation selection UI into a more intuitive button grid layout.
tasks.details:
This task involves a complete refactor of the main user-facing conversion tool from Alpine.js to Livewire. The primary goals are to eliminate all 'unsafe-eval' CSP violations caused by Alpine, improve maintainability by centralizing logic in PHP, and enhance user experience with a redesigned UI.

**1. Livewire Component Creation:**
   - Generate a new Livewire component: `php artisan make:livewire UniversalConverter`.
   - Define public properties to manage state, mirroring the old Alpine component: `$inputText`, `$outputText`, `$selectedTransformation`, `$transformationOptions`, etc.

tasks.title: Verify and update CSP configuration for Livewire-only approach
tasks.description: Ensure Content Security Policy headers are configured for strict CSP without unsafe-eval or unsafe-inline for scripts, verify Livewire works correctly with strict CSP, and update CSP middleware to reflect that Alpine.js is no longer used
tasks.details:
Complete CSP configuration update for Livewire-only implementation:

1. **CSP MIDDLEWARE CONFIGURATION UPDATE:**
   - Open app/Http/Middleware/ContentSecurityPolicy.php or GenerateCspNonce.php
   - Remove any Alpine.js-specific CSP allowances or comments
   - Ensure script-src directive is: `'self' 'nonce-{nonce}'` (no unsafe-eval, no unsafe-inline)
   - Verify style-src directive includes nonce for Livewire inline styles: `'self' 'nonce-{nonce}'`
   - Remove any legacy Alpine.js CSP workarounds or exceptions
   - Update CSP header comment to indicate Livewire-only approach

2. **LIVEWIRE CSP CONFIGURATION:**
   - Open config/livewire.php and verify CSP settings
   - Ensure `'inject_assets' => true` for proper asset injection
   - Verify `'inject_morph_markers' => true` for DOM diffing
   - Check that Livewire's JavaScript is loaded with proper nonce attribute
   - Confirm wire:navigate and wire:snapshot work with strict CSP

3. **NONCE GENERATION AND INJECTION:**
   - Verify nonce generation in middleware: `$nonce = base64_encode(random_bytes(16))`
   - Confirm nonce is passed to all views via View::share or middleware
   - Check app.blade.php uses nonce in script tags: `<script nonce="{{ csp_nonce() }}">`
   - Verify Livewire scripts include nonce: `@livewireScripts(['nonce' => csp_nonce()])`
   - Ensure any remaining inline scripts use nonce attribute

4. **REMOVE ALPINE.JS CSP WORKAROUNDS:**
   - Search for any CSP exceptions added for Alpine.js
   - Remove comments mentioning Alpine CSP issues
   - Delete any conditional CSP rules based on Alpine presence
   - Clean up any Alpine-specific nonce handling code
   - Remove Alpine from any CSP allow-lists or exceptions

5. **STRICT CSP HEADER IMPLEMENTATION:**
   ```php
   // app/Http/Middleware/ContentSecurityPolicy.php
   public function handle($request, $next)
   {
       $response = $next($request);
       $nonce = base64_encode(random_bytes(16));
       
       // Store nonce for view usage
       View::share('csp_nonce', $nonce);
       
       // Strict CSP for Livewire-only approach
       $csp = "default-src 'self'; ".
              "script-src 'self' 'nonce-{$nonce}'; ".
              "style-src 'self' 'nonce-{$nonce}'; ".
              "img-src 'self' data: https:; ".
              "font-src 'self' data:; ".
              "connect-src 'self'; ".
              "frame-ancestors 'none'; ".
              "base-uri 'self'; ".
              "form-action 'self'";
       
       $response->headers->set('Content-Security-Policy', $csp);
       return $response;
   }
   ```

tasks.title: Redesign Main Converter as a Premium, Native-Feeling Transformation Tool
tasks.description: Overhaul the main converter UI/UX from a basic form into a premium, real-time, multi-pane tool using Livewire, focusing on performance, advanced features like diff highlighting, and a native-app feel.
tasks.details:
This task involves a complete redesign of the primary text converter interface to create a best-in-class user experience. The new implementation will be a single, highly-interactive Livewire component, replacing the previous, more basic implementation.

**1. Component Architecture & UI/UX:**
- Create a new Livewire component, e.g., `PremiumConverter.php`, to manage all state and logic.
- Implement a two-pane (side-by-side) responsive layout for 'Input' and 'Output' text areas. The layout should adapt gracefully to mobile viewports (e.g., stacking vertically).
- Use `wire:model.live.debounce.250ms` on the input textarea to provide real-time transformation previews in the output pane as the user types.
- Integrate the existing transformation tool selector (from Task #44), ensuring it communicates with the new parent Livewire component to trigger re-transformations.
- Add a dedicated action bar with buttons for 'Copy Output', 'Clear Panes', and 'Swap Input/Output'.

**2. Advanced Feature Implementation:**
- **Diff Highlighting:** Implement a text-diffing feature. When a transformation is applied, use a server-side library (e.g., `jblond/php-diff`) to compare the input and output. Render the output with `<ins>` and `<del>` tags and corresponding CSS to visually highlight the changes.
- **Real-time Statistics:** Display live-updating character, word, and line counts for both the input and output panes. These will be computed properties in the Livewire component, updated on each transformation.
- **State Persistence:** Use browser `localStorage` (via JavaScript dispatch events listened to by Livewire) to automatically save and restore the user's last input text and selected tool, creating a seamless experience across sessions.

**3. Performance & Polish:**
- Utilize `wire:loading` states to provide visual feedback (e.g., subtle spinners or pane opacity changes) during server round-trips.
- Apply `wire:ignore` to static elements of the component to minimize DOM patching and improve client-side performance.
- Ensure all backend transformation logic is performant enough to handle rapid, debounced updates without noticeable lag.
- Implement toast notifications (e.g., 'Copied to clipboard!') for user actions to provide clear, non-intrusive feedback.
tasks.testStrategy:
A multi-faceted testing approach is required to validate the new converter's functionality, performance, and user experience.

**1. Livewire Component Testing (Pest/PHPUnit):**
- Write tests to verify that the `output` property is correctly updated when the `input` property changes.
- Test that changing the selected tool via its property correctly re-applies the transformation to the existing input.
- Unit test the server-side diffing logic to ensure it generates correct HTML for various text changes.
- Assert that the statistics (word count, char count) are calculated correctly for different inputs.

**2. Browser Automation Testing (Dusk/Playwright):**
- Verify the two-pane layout renders correctly and is responsive across desktop and mobile breakpoints.
- Simulate typing in the input field and assert that the output pane updates in near real-time with the transformed text.
- Test all action buttons: click 'Copy' and assert clipboard content; click 'Clear' and assert panes are empty; click 'Swap' and assert content is exchanged.
- Validate the diff highlighting: apply a transformation (e.g., 'lowercase') and assert that the output pane contains the correct `<ins>`/`<del>` tags and associated CSS classes.
- Test state persistence: set input text, refresh the page, and assert that the text and selected tool are restored.

**3. Manual & Compliance Testing:**
- Manually test with very large text inputs (e.g., >500KB) to check for UI lag or server timeouts.
- Use browser developer tools to monitor network requests, ensuring `wire:model` updates are properly debounced.
- Perform a final check with strict Content Security Policy (CSP) headers enabled to confirm that the new diffing HTML and any other changes have not introduced any `unsafe-inline` or other violations.

tasks.title: Implement Theme System with Auto/Light/Dark Toggle
tasks.description: Implement a high-priority theme system featuring a segmented control in the top-right corner with Auto, Light, and Dark options, persisting user preference in localStorage and ensuring smooth visual transitions.
tasks.details:
1. **Component Implementation:**
   - Create a new client-side component (e.g., using Alpine.js) for the theme toggle to ensure immediate responsiveness without server round-trips.
   - Place the component in the main application layout, fixed to the top-right corner of the viewport.

2. **UI - Segmented Control:**
   - Build a three-option segmented control styled with the existing glassmorphism system (Task 4).
   - Use icons for each option: a desktop/monitor icon for 'Auto', a sun icon for 'Light', and a moon icon for 'Dark'.
   - The active state should be clearly indicated, following the established design system's accent colors.

3. **State Management & Persistence:**
   - On component initialization, check for a 'theme' key in `localStorage`.
   - If no key exists, default to 'Auto'.
   - When a user selects an option, update the `localStorage` key with the chosen value ('auto', 'light', or 'dark').
   - The application should immediately reflect the theme on subsequent page loads by reading this value.

4. **Theme Logic:**
   - **Initialization Script:** Add a script to the `<head>` of the document that runs before the body renders. This script will read `localStorage` and `prefers-color-scheme` to apply the correct theme class (e.g., 'dark') to the `<html>` element, preventing a Flash of Unstyled Content (FOUC).
   - **'Auto' Mode:** Use `window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')` to detect the user's OS-level preference. Add an event listener to this media query to automatically switch the theme if the OS setting changes while the app is open.
   - **'Light'/'Dark' Modes:** Directly add or remove the 'dark' class from the `<html>` element to override the 'Auto' behavior.

5. **CSS & Styling:**
   - Refactor the main stylesheet to use CSS custom properties for all colors, shadows, and backgrounds.
   - Define the default (light) theme variables under `:root`.
   - Define the dark theme overrides within a `html.dark` selector block.
   - Ensure all components, including those from tasks 4, 59, 60, and 44, use these CSS variables for their styling to support theming.

6. **Smooth Transition (300ms Fade):**
   - When the theme is changed, trigger a transition effect.
   - Create a full-screen, fixed-position overlay element with `background-color: #808080` (neutral gray) and `opacity: 0`, `pointer-events: none`.
   - On theme change: 
     a. Animate the overlay's opacity to 1 over 150ms.
     b. Once the animation completes, switch the 'dark' class on the `<html>` element.
     c. Immediately animate the overlay's opacity back to 0 over 150ms.

tasks.title: Implement Primary Transformation Tabs Component
tasks.description: Develop a reusable Blade component for the primary transformation tabs (Title Case, Sentence case, etc.) featuring equal-width distribution, active state indicators, and full keyboard navigation support.
tasks.details:
Implementation of a reusable primary tabs Blade component:

1.  **Component Structure & File Path:**
    *   Create a new Blade component at `resources/views/components/primary-tabs.blade.php`.
    *   The component should accept an array of tab data and the initially active tab as props: `@props(['tabs', 'activeTabId'])`.

2.  **HTML & ARIA Implementation:**
    *   Use semantic HTML with appropriate ARIA roles for accessibility.
    *   The main container should be a `div` with `role="tablist"` and an `aria-label` (e.g., "Primary text transformations").
    *   Each tab should be a `<button>` with `role="tab"`. Using buttons is crucial for accessibility over `<a>` tags when controlling on-page content.
    *   Implement ARIA states: `aria-selected` should be `"true"` for the active tab and `"false"` for others. `aria-controls` on each tab button should point to the `id` of its corresponding tab panel.
    *   Tab panels should have `role="tabpanel"` and be associated with their tab via `aria-labelledby`.

3.  **Styling and Layout (Tailwind CSS):**
    *   **Container:** Use Flexbox (`flex`) to create the horizontal row.
    *   **Tabs:** Each tab button should use `flex-1` to achieve equal width distribution. Set a fixed height of `h-11` (44px). Use `flex`, `items-center`, `justify-center` for content alignment.
    *   **Active State:**
        *   Apply a `border-b-2` with the accent color (e.g., `border-blue-500`) from the design system (Task 4).
        *   Apply a subtle background tint using opacity (e.g., `bg-blue-500/10`).
        *   The active tab text should have a higher contrast color (e.g., `text-slate-900 dark:text-slate-100`).
    *   **Inactive State:** Tabs should have a more subtle text color (e.g., `text-slate-600 dark:text-slate-400`).
    *   **Transitions:** Apply `transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out` to tab buttons for smooth changes to color, background, and border-color.

4.  **Interactivity (Alpine.js):**
    *   Manage state within the component using `x-data="{ activeTab: '{{ $activeTabId }}' }"`.
    *   Use `@click="activeTab = 'tab-id'"` on each button to change the active state.
    *   Conditionally apply active state classes and `aria-selected` attribute: `:class="{ 'border-blue-500 bg-blue-500/10 font-semibold': activeTab === 'tab-id' }"` and `:aria-selected="activeTab === 'tab-id'"`.
    *   Control the visibility of tab panels using `x-show="activeTab === 'tab-id'"`.

5.  **Keyboard Navigation (ARIA Best Practices):**
    *   Implement keyboard navigation on the `tablist` container.
    *   `@keydown.arrow-right.prevent="$focus.wrap().next()"`
    *   `@keydown.arrow-left.prevent="$focus.wrap().previous()"`
    *   `@keydown.home.prevent="$focus.first()"`
    *   `@keydown.end.prevent="$focus.last()"`
    *   Activation via `Space` and `Enter` is native to `<button>` elements and does not require extra implementation.
tasks.testStrategy:
Comprehensive validation of the primary tabs component:

1.  **Visual Verification:**
    *   Confirm the component renders five tabs: 'Title Case', 'Sentence case', 'UPPERCASE', 'lowercase', and 'Explore All'.
    *   Verify all tabs have equal width and a height of 44px.
    *   Check that the default active tab displays the accent color underline and background tint correctly.
    *   Toggle between light and dark modes to ensure styles adapt properly, referencing variables from Task 40.
    *   Verify hover and focus states provide clear visual feedback.

2.  **Functional Testing:**
    *   Click on each tab and confirm the active state indicator moves to the clicked tab.
    *   Verify that clicking a tab reveals its corresponding content panel and hides the others.
    *   Observe the active state transition and confirm it is a smooth 200ms animation.

3.  **Accessibility & Keyboard Navigation Testing:**
    *   Use the `Tab` key to navigate to the tab group. Focus should land on the currently active tab.
    *   Press the Right Arrow key; focus must move to the next tab, wrapping from the last to the first.
    *   Press the Left Arrow key; focus must move to the previous tab, wrapping from the first to the last.
    *   Press the `Home` key; focus must move to the first tab.
    *   Press the `End` key; focus must move to the last tab.
    *   With focus on an inactive tab, press `Space` or `Enter`. The tab must become active, and its panel must be displayed.
    *   Use a screen reader (e.g., NVDA, VoiceOver) to verify that roles (`tablist`, `tab`, `tabpanel`) and states (`selected`) are announced correctly.

4.  **Integration Testing:**
    *   Place the component within `home.blade.php` (Task 31) and ensure it integrates seamlessly with the existing layout without causing style conflicts.

tasks.title: Add Auto-Resize Textarea with Character Counter and Options
tasks.description: Enhance the main input textarea to auto-resize based on content, display a real-time character counter, include a conditional clear button, and provide a monospace font toggle option.
tasks.details:
Implementation of an enhanced textarea component:

1.  **Component Structure:**
    *   Create a self-contained component (e.g., using Alpine.js or a dedicated vanilla JS class) to manage the textarea and its associated UI elements. This component will encapsulate all logic for resizing, counting, clearing, and settings.
    *   The component will be placed within the main content area, replacing the current basic textarea.

2.  **Auto-Resizing Textarea:**
    *   Use JavaScript to dynamically adjust the `height` of the textarea on the `input` event.
    *   The logic should calculate the `scrollHeight` and apply it to the element's style, respecting the defined boundaries.
    *   Apply CSS constraints: `min-height: 100px;`, `max-height: 300px;`, and `overflow-y: auto;` to ensure a scrollbar appears when content exceeds the maximum height.
    *   The resize logic must also run on initial component load to handle any pre-filled text.

3.  **Character Counter:**
    *   Add a `<div>` or `<span>` element positioned absolutely in the bottom-right corner, inside the textarea's container.
    *   Set the `maxlength="5000"` attribute on the `<textarea>` element.
    *   On each `input` event, update the counter's text content to reflect the format: `${textarea.value.length} / 5000`.

4.  **Clear Button:**
    *   Implement a `<button>` with an 'X' SVG icon, positioned absolutely in the top-right corner of the textarea container.
    *   The button's visibility should be conditionally rendered, appearing only when `textarea.value.length > 0`.
    *   On click, the button's event handler must:
        *   Clear the textarea's value.
        *   Dispatch an `input` event to ensure the character counter and other dependent components update.
        *   Trigger the resize logic to shrink the textarea to its `min-height`.

5.  **Monospace Font Toggle:**
    *   Add a small 'settings' (gear icon) button near the textarea.
    *   On click, this button will toggle a small popover or dropdown menu.
    *   The menu will contain a UI switch for 'Monospace Font'.
    *   Toggling the switch will add/remove a class (e.g., `font-monospace`) to the textarea element.
    *   The user's preference for the monospace font should be persisted in `localStorage` and applied on page load.

tasks.title: Implement Global Keyboard Shortcuts System
tasks.description: Implement a global keyboard shortcut system for core application functions like navigation, actions, and accessibility, and display these shortcuts in a new help modal.
tasks.details:
1. **Shortcut Listener Implementation:**
   - Integrate a lightweight, dependency-free keyboard event listener (e.g., a custom Alpine.js or vanilla JS module) at the global `window` level.
   - The listener must correctly interpret `event.metaKey` for Command (Cmd) on macOS and `event.ctrlKey` for Control (Ctrl) on other operating systems.
   - Implement logic to prevent default browser actions for conflicting shortcuts, specifically for `Cmd/Ctrl+D` (Bookmark) and `Cmd/Ctrl+K` (Search).

2. **Shortcut Action Mapping:**
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + 1-4`**: Programmatically trigger a click or state change on the corresponding primary transformation tab component from Task #66.
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + 5`**: Trigger the action associated with the 'Explore' tab/button from Task #66, likely opening the discovery section from Task #44.
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + C`**: Invoke the 'copy' method on the Smart Utility Bar component from Task #60.
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + D`**: Invoke the 'download' method on the Smart Utility Bar component from Task #60.
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + /`**: Call the theme toggle function from the theme system component in Task #65.
   - **`Cmd/Ctrl + K`**: Set focus directly to the main text input area. Ensure this works globally.
   - **`ESC`**: When the discovery section (from Task #44) is active/visible, this key should trigger its close mechanism. The listener must be context-aware to avoid closing other elements.

3. **Help Modal Implementation:**
   - Create a new, accessible modal component to display the list of available shortcuts.
   - Add a trigger button (e.g., a '?' icon) to the main UI, likely in the application header or footer.
   - Style the modal and its backdrop using the established glassmorphism design system (Task #4).
   - The modal content should present shortcuts in a clear, two-column table: `Key(s)` and `Action`.
   - Ensure the modal is fully accessible: traps focus, can be closed with the `ESC` key, and has appropriate ARIA attributes.

tasks.title: Resolve CSRF Token Mismatches on API Endpoints
tasks.description: Fix 419 (Page Expired) errors occurring on API endpoints by correctly configuring CSRF token handling for AJAX requests or excluding stateless API routes from CSRF verification.
tasks.details:
The newly created API endpoints from Task 70 are failing with 419 errors, indicating a CSRF token issue. The resolution depends on the intended architecture (stateful vs. stateless).

1. **Investigation:**
   - Determine if the routes (`/api/categories`, `/api/transform`) are defined in `routes/web.php` or `routes/api.php`.
   - The `web` middleware group applies CSRF protection by default, while the `api` group does not.

2. **Option A: Exclude API Routes from CSRF (Recommended for Stateless APIs):**
   - If these endpoints are intended to be stateless and consumed by third parties or a decoupled frontend, they should not be subject to CSRF protection.
   - Open `app/Http/Middleware/VerifyCsrfToken.php`.
   - Add the API routes to the `$except` array to bypass verification.
   - Example:
     ```php
     protected $except = [
         'api/categories',
         'api/transform'
     ];
     ```
   - This is the quickest fix. The long-term solution for true APIs is to ensure they are in `routes/api.php` and protected by a token-based system like Laravel Sanctum, not session-based CSRF.

3. **Option B: Include CSRF Token in Frontend Requests (For Stateful SPAs):**
   - If the API is serving a tightly-coupled frontend (like Alpine.js components within Blade), the frontend must send the CSRF token with every AJAX request.
   - **Step 3.1: Add Meta Tag:** Ensure the main application layout (`resources/views/layouts/app.blade.php`) contains the CSRF token meta tag in the `<head>` section.
     ```html
     <meta name="csrf-token" content="{{ csrf_token() }}">
     ```
   - **Step 3.2: Configure Axios/Fetch:** Configure the global JavaScript HTTP client to automatically include the token. If using Axios, add this to `resources/js/bootstrap.js`:
     ```javascript
     window.axios.defaults.headers.common['X-CSRF-TOKEN'] = document.querySelector('meta[name="csrf-token"]').getAttribute('content');
     ```
   - If using the native Fetch API, the header must be added manually to each `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH`, or `DELETE` request.

It should read the component's `$input` property, apply the currently selected transformation (retrieved from the component's state), and update the `$output` property.

tasks.details:

     * Pattern: 'style="' inline style attributes
     * Pattern: 'x-data', 'x-show', 'x-model', '@click' Alpine directives
     * Pattern: 'eval(', 'Function(', 'setTimeout with strings'

     ```bash
     # Alpine.js detection
     grep -r "alpine\|x-data\|x-show\|x-model\|@click" --include="*.blade.php" --include="*.js" --include="*.json"
     
     # Inline styles detection
     grep -r 'style="' --include="*.blade.php" --include="*.php"
     
     # Unsafe eval detection

     ```
   - Set up automated alerts for any violation detection
   - Create violation report generator: .taskmaster/reports/csp-violations.log

4. **ENFORCEMENT MECHANISMS:**

5. **CONTINUOUS COMPLIANCE MONITORING:**

Comprehensive Alpine.js removal and migration process:

1. **FINAL ALPINE.JS AUDIT:**
   - Run comprehensive search for any remaining Alpine traces:
     * `grep -r 'Alpine' . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
     * `grep -r 'x-data\|x-show\|x-on\|@click\|:class' resources/views/ --include='*.blade.php'`
     * `grep -r 'alpine' . -i --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
   - Check for Alpine CDN links in any template files
   - Verify no Alpine plugins or extensions remain
   - Document any findings that need removal

2. **JAVASCRIPT FILE CLEANUP:**
   - Remove all Alpine-related code from resources/js/app.js:
     * Delete import Alpine from 'alpinejs'
     * Remove window.Alpine assignments
     * Delete Alpine.start() calls
     * Remove any Alpine.data() registrations
     * Clean up Alpine plugin imports
   - Delete Alpine-specific component files:
     * Remove resources/js/alpine-converter.js if present
     * Delete any Alpine component modules
   - Update bootstrap.js to remove Alpine references

3. **BLADE TEMPLATE MIGRATION:**
   - Replace Alpine.js directives with Livewire equivalents:
     * Convert x-data="{open: false}" to Livewire properties
     * Replace x-show with Livewire conditionals or CSS classes
     * Convert @click to wire:click directives
     * Replace x-model with wire:model
     * Convert :class bindings to standard class attributes
   - For non-Livewire components, implement vanilla JavaScript:
     * Replace Alpine toggles with classList.toggle()
     * Convert Alpine state to data attributes or JS variables
     * Use addEventListener instead of Alpine event handlers

4. **BUILD CONFIGURATION CLEANUP:**
   - Update webpack.mix.js or vite.config.js:
     * Remove Alpine from build pipeline
     * Delete Alpine-related plugins or configurations
     * Clean up any Alpine-specific build optimizations
   - Update tailwind.config.js if Alpine utilities were added
   - Remove Alpine from any PostCSS configurations

5. **PACKAGE CLEANUP:**
   - Remove Alpine and all plugins from package.json:
     * Run `npm uninstall alpinejs`
     * Run `npm uninstall @alpinejs/persist @alpinejs/focus @alpinejs/collapse`
     * Remove any other Alpine-related packages
   - Clean node_modules: `rm -rf node_modules && npm install`
   - Update package-lock.json with clean install

6. **LIVEWIRE COMPONENT MIGRATION:**
   - Create Livewire components for interactive features:
     * Dropdown menus: app/Livewire/NavigationDropdown.php
     * Search modal: app/Livewire/SearchModal.php
     * Theme toggle: app/Livewire/ThemeToggle.php
     * Mobile menu: app/Livewire/MobileMenu.php
   - Implement proper Livewire lifecycle hooks
   - Add wire:model bindings for form inputs
   - Use wire:click for interactive elements

7. **VANILLA JAVASCRIPT REPLACEMENTS:**
   - Create resources/js/interactions.js for simple interactions:
     * Implement dropdown toggles with querySelectorAll and event listeners
     * Add mobile menu functionality with classList methods
     * Create copy-to-clipboard without Alpine
     * Implement theme switching with localStorage
   - Ensure all JS follows modern ES6+ patterns
   - Add proper error handling and fallbacks

8. **COMPONENT LIBRARY UPDATE:**
   - Update all Blade components in resources/views/components/:
     * Remove Alpine directives from component templates
     * Add Livewire wire:* attributes where needed
     * Implement data-* attributes for JS hooks
   - Ensure components work without Alpine.js
   - Test each component in isolation

9. **ASSET REBUILD:**
   - Clear all compiled assets: `rm -rf public/build public/js public/css`
   - Rebuild assets: `npm run build` or `npm run production`
   - Verify no Alpine code in compiled bundles
   - Check bundle sizes are reduced

10. **DOCUMENTATION UPDATE:**
    - Update README.md to remove Alpine.js references
    - Document new Livewire component usage
    - Add vanilla JavaScript interaction documentation
    - Update deployment guides

4. **PERFORMANCE VALIDATION:**

   - Check all category pages load
   - Test responsive layouts maintained
   - Confirm accessibility features intact

tasks.title: STRICT CSP ENFORCEMENT: Remove 'unsafe-eval' from CSP headers immediately
tasks.description: Immediately enforce strict Content Security Policy by removing ALL instances of 'unsafe-eval' and 'unsafe-inline' from CSP headers, ensuring only 'self' and nonce-based directives are used for script-src and style-src
tasks.details:
IMMEDIATE AND NON-NEGOTIABLE CSP ENFORCEMENT:

1. **CRITICAL CSP HEADER UPDATE:**
   - Locate ALL CSP header definitions in the codebase:
     * Search middleware files: `grep -r "Content-Security-Policy" app/Http/Middleware/`
     * Check config files: `grep -r "csp\|Content-Security" config/`
     * Examine .htaccess: `grep -r "Content-Security-Policy" public/.htaccess`
     * Review nginx/apache configs if present
   - MANDATORY CSP directive format:
     * `script-src 'self' 'nonce-{nonce}';`
     * `style-src 'self' 'nonce-{nonce}';`
     * ABSOLUTELY NO: 'unsafe-eval', 'unsafe-inline', 'unsafe-hashes'
   - Remove ANY fallback or compatibility modes that include unsafe directives

2. **ENFORCE NONCE-BASED SECURITY:**
   - Implement CSP nonce generation in middleware:
     ```php
     $nonce = base64_encode(random_bytes(16));
     $response->headers->set('Content-Security-Policy', 
         "script-src 'self' 'nonce-$nonce'; style-src 'self' 'nonce-$nonce';"
     );
     ```
   - Pass nonce to all views via View::share('cspNonce', $nonce)
   - Update ALL script tags: `<script nonce="{{ $cspNonce }}">`
   - Update ALL style tags: `<style nonce="{{ $cspNonce }}">`

3. **ELIMINATE ALL EVAL-BASED CODE:**
   - Search and destroy eval patterns:
     * `grep -r "eval(" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
     * `grep -r "Function(" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
     * `grep -r "setTimeout.*['\"]" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
   - Replace dynamic code execution with safe alternatives
   - Remove any libraries that require eval (including Alpine.js if still present)

4. **PURGE INLINE STYLES:**
   - Find all inline styles: `grep -r 'style="' resources/views/ --include='*.blade.php'`
   - Move ALL inline styles to external stylesheets with nonce attributes
   - Use Tailwind classes exclusively for styling
   - NO EXCEPTIONS for inline styles

5. **VALIDATION GATES:**
   - Create .taskmaster/csp-validator.sh script:
     ```bash
     #!/bin/bash
     # FAIL if unsafe-eval found
     grep -r "unsafe-eval" . --exclude-dir=node_modules && exit 1
     # FAIL if unsafe-inline found
     grep -r "unsafe-inline" . --exclude-dir=node_modules && exit 1
     # FAIL if Alpine.js present
     grep -r "alpine" package.json && exit 1
     echo "CSP VALIDATION PASSED"
     ```
   - Add to pre-commit hooks
   - Add to CI/CD pipeline

6. **AGENT ENFORCEMENT PROTOCOL:**
   - ANY agent that adds back 'unsafe-eval' = IMMEDIATE FAILURE
   - ANY agent that adds back 'unsafe-inline' = IMMEDIATE FAILURE
   - ANY agent that reintroduces Alpine.js = IMMEDIATE FAILURE
   - Document violations in .taskmaster/csp-violations.log
tasks.testStrategy:
MANDATORY CSP COMPLIANCE VERIFICATION:

1. **CSP HEADER VALIDATION:**
   - Inspect response headers in browser DevTools Network tab
   - Confirm CSP header contains ONLY:
     * `script-src 'self' 'nonce-[valid-nonce]'`
     * `style-src 'self' 'nonce-[valid-nonce]'`
   - FAIL if header contains: 'unsafe-eval', 'unsafe-inline', 'unsafe-hashes'
   - Use curl to verify: `curl -I http://localhost | grep Content-Security-Policy`

2. **CONSOLE ERROR MONITORING:**
   - Open browser console on every page
   - ZERO CSP violations should appear
   - Any "Refused to execute inline script" = FAILURE
   - Any "Refused to evaluate a string" = FAILURE
   - Document any violations found

3. **CODE SCAN VERIFICATION:**
   - Run: `grep -r "unsafe-eval" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
   - Must return ZERO results
   - Run: `grep -r "unsafe-inline" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
   - Must return ZERO results
   - Run: `grep -r "eval(\|Function(" . --exclude-dir=node_modules --exclude-dir=vendor`
   - Must return ZERO results

4. **ALPINE.JS ABSENCE CONFIRMATION:**
   - Verify: `npm ls alpinejs` returns "empty"
   - Check: `grep -r "alpine" package.json` returns nothing
   - Confirm no Alpine directives: `grep -r "x-data\|x-show\|@click" resources/views/`

5. **FUNCTIONAL TESTING:**
   - Test ALL interactive features still work without eval
   - Verify Livewire components function correctly
   - Confirm no JavaScript functionality is broken
   - Test in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)

6. **AUTOMATED ENFORCEMENT:**
   - Run .taskmaster/csp-validator.sh - must pass
   - Add to CI pipeline - any failure blocks deployment
   - Set up monitoring alerts for CSP violations in production
